result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Anton Sheriff-Bruckert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment or combination of employment and education equivalent to full time.

Employment to be in an occupation approved by agent.  

Defendant shall not voluntarily quit his employment without agent approval.

Obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.

Comply with any risk and needs assessments and any other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.

Comply with any case plan goals related to criminogenic needs and follow through with programming recommended by the Department of Corrections.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Defendant shall not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Defendant to obtain housing that meets with his agent's approval.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample if one has not already been submitted. 

Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence currently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
